name: Toronto Tango 8 Festival & Marathon - 11th Edition

location.name: Argentine Tango Toronto by Bulent & Lina

description: The biggest Tango event and Tango festival in Ontario, Canada. A 5-day celebration of Tango dance and Tango music from Buenos Aires, Argentina. There will be Tango workshops, Tango master classes, Tango shows as well as non-stop dance events with international Tango DJs. As part of our community building initiatives, there is also free Tango lessons for beginners at the event.

organizer.name: Argentine Tango Toronto by Bulent & Lina

name: Crossings exhibition
description:
A '"Crossing" could be an intersection of ideas and viewpoints represented in the abstract, or the crossing of physical space via a road or bridge, or the crossing of an ocean towards a new life. 

It could mean crossing into a different emotional state, when inspired or uplifted, or even a new state of being in a different plane of existence.

name: United Through Watercolour Art Exhibition
description:
Enjoy the wonder of watercolour as artists from across Canada and the world unite for this exhibit. International Watercolour Society's annual show explores new techniques and methods.

Join the Artists for the opening reception on Sunday, September 28, 2 to 4 p.m. Light refreshments provided.

name: Creating Your Archive with Raegan Swanson
description:
Led by Raegan Swanson, Executive Director of The ArQuives: Canada's LGBTQ+ Archives, this session will focus on how artists can work to document their own story and history. 

Photos, letters, diaries, and art all tell a story about who we are and how we interact with the world. The workshop will include a discussion on how to collect your materials, how you might get materials organized, and what donating to an archive can include to preserve your creative legacy.
